snippet: Local brigades claim the mantle of guardians, but many civilians worry that they could bully voters, suppress votes or otherwise dominate upcoming elections.
abstract: Militia leaders in Libya are plunging into politics, raising fears that armed brigades could undermine elections intended to lay foundation of a new democracy; insist they are compensating for leadership failures of the Transitional National Council, but they often continue to rely on armed might outside any legal or political process.
lead_paragraph: Local brigades claim the mantle of guardians, but many civilians worry that they could bully voters, suppress votes or otherwise dominate upcoming elections.

headline.seo: Libya Militias Turn to Politics, a Volatile Mix
headline.main: Libyan Militias Turn to Politics, a Volatile Mix
headline.print_headline: Libyan Militias Turn to Politics, A Volatile Mix
